subject: Horse Racing
Horses
lead_paragraph: Barely a week after being purchased, Student Council made his first trip to the West Coast and stunned the defending champion Lava Man yesterday to win the $1 million Pacific Classic by a half-length at Del Mar in California.Sent off as the even-money favorite, Lava Man faded to sixth.“I thought he ran a great race,” Lava Man’s trainer, Doug O’Neill, said. “He just wasn’t good enough.”Eager to win the Pacific Classic after his horse Super Frolic finished third last year and fifth in 2005, the owner Ro Parra bought Student Council on Aug. 10 from Will Farish, who bred Student Council.The horse was shipped from Saratoga to Del Mar, where the trainer Vladimir Cerin gave him a few workouts on the new synthetic Polytrack surface.At 23-1 odds, Student Council and the jockey Richard Migliore covered one and a quarter miles in 2 minutes 7.29 seconds and paid $48.80 on a $2 bet to win. The horse’s time was the slowest in race history, although the Classic was being run on Polytrack for the first time.
